prompt: Let's recap where we are now.

Let's check our CLI that we use for bootstrapping and make sure it has all of the required functionality for storage, DHT, Geographic routing, etc. We want to make the CLI a full-functioning node that will store information for us, and I will get an MCP server set up so that we can configure that in multiple DigitalOcean locations.
Let's commit this and check that we get the releases so that we can set up our DigitalOcean instances.
/orchestrate
Perfect. Let's move our orchestration on.

Let's just check with the four-word identity system. 

What we're going to do here is the user gets four words. The hash of those four words becomes the DHT key for that user's identity packet. It will also include a public key, and the user can sign the words with that public key. 

So anybody can be given those four words and find that user's identity packet. And within that packet, we can have things like the user can update it with the current forwards of the machine that they're on for direct communication (or it could be that it's used for a website publishing location), which we will use for each of the storage parts of our Communitas app. 

For individuals, groups, organisations, projects, groups within the organisation, channels, individuals—each of these can have their own identity packet, with these storage locations using the same four-word mechanism. 

It's really the four words are used to capture a particular DHT packet. Using those four words and those four words only, the DHT should reject any ability to create a DHT packet that doesn't have four words recognised from our dictionary, where the hash of those four words is DHT identity. I hope that helps.

Yes, please continue with the documentation for this architecture.

It will allow us to create a whole new web where the forward identity system is for easy ways to create links. When everybody has a storage mechanism (where people are able to create a website there and a blog there), that forward identity packet will be the link to their website or blog. Within the website or blog, they can have links to other forward identity packets for other people's website or blog. They can also link to documents within other people's website or blog.

So, it's a reimagining of the whole internet as a text-based internet using markdown files. For applications on the internet later on, we will be using the MCP system, so we ignore apps at the moment. It's just a markdown web.
/orchestrate-analyze
